content: you Wow I have been busy with all kinds of
good stuff not the least of which is that new intro let's check it out again
real quick yeah look at the scroll tube with the thing coming off its goal right
it took me 17 hours to figure that out I need to spend more time with my wife
anyway quick plug I finished the vault of it is
once and for all so in case you missed it the first time around you can head
over the dm's guild and find it there if you didn't miss it the first time around
I assure you it's very different lots of artwork totally rebuilt from the ground
up temp living formatting all that good stuff so head on over pay what you want
to dear old Wai lock and check out episode 17 to build that dungeon in real
time so let's get on with season 3 we'll pick up right where we left off you saw
some metal doors in episode 30 and I'm going to show you how to build them now
begin by cutting out some chipboard rectangles which are one and a quarter
inch by two inch you'll need two of them for each door
now cut out some rectangles of double corrugated cardboard one and a quarter
inch by one and a half inch you'll need one of these per door hot glue a
chipboard rectangle to each side as shown measure the width of your door
should be right at three-eighths of an inch and cut some corrugation cladding
to that width and hot glue it on as we've done before
now using some thin cardstock cut out more rectangles at one and a quarter
inch by two inch again you'll need two per door from these we want to cut out
the middle portion such that we're left with a frame that's about a quarter of
an inch thick all around you could measure this out but I'm just going to
freehand it glue these frames to each side of the door use white glue instead
of hot glue base in black paint both sides of the door and the corrugation
cladding with a metallic gunmetal type of color next we're going to use the
exact same beads that we use for the potion bottle caps back in episode 7 hot
glue these around the frame these are the rivets I use needle nose pliers to
help because they're so tiny you want them to be evenly spaced
lastly here's some gears and gear like beads that I got from Michael's I'm just
gonna hot glue them right in the center of the door one per side try and mix it
up to get some variety yeah I like these a lot so they go well in a fantasy
setting but they have a bit of a steampunk vibe to them too so if you
wanted you could use them there and arguably they would fit in a futuristic
sci-fi type of setting - so pretty versatile and remember the principle
behind this which we're going to use in the next few episodes really you just
need some kind of material that is as thick as your walls and you put that in
the middle and sandwich it with really whatever you want
and you can make any kind of clip-on feature you want any kind of door that
you can imagine so thanks for watching I am why lock and I'll see you next time
